solution_line_template: First find the volume of the pool by multiplying the length by the width by the height: {pool_length} ft * {pool_width} ft * {pool_depth} ft = <<{pool_length}*{pool_width}*{pool_depth}={pool_volume}>>{pool_volume} cubic feet

Then divide the volume of the pool by the number of cubic feet one quart of chlorine can sterilize: {pool_volume} cubic feet / {cubic_feet_per_quart} cubic feet/quart = <<{pool_volume}/{cubic_feet_per_quart}={quarts_needed}>>{quarts_needed} quarts

Then multiply the number of quarts Gary needs to buy by the price per quart to find out how much money he spends: ${cost_per_quart}/quart * {quarts_needed} quarts = $<<{cost_per_quart}*{quarts_needed}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
